nodes.text: HoloNet News — Chancellor Palpatine's Approval Rating Falls

HoloNet News — Chancellor Palpatine's Approval Rating Falls, released on December 12, 2008, is the third installment in the online HoloNet News podcast series that accompanied the development of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series. With a length of about seventy-three seconds, the podcast features a news report on Republic Supreme Chancellor Palpatine's public approval ratings falling to 81%. The podcast was written by Pablo Hidalgo and features the voice talents of David W. Collins and Stephen J. Sansweet.

From Dateline Coruscant, a HoloNet News agency on the Republic capital planet Coruscant, anchor Rule Davenbay reports that Supreme Chancellor Palpatine's approval rating among Inner Core citizens has fallen to 81%. According to the independent polling agency Chokee & Chokee, Palpatine's approval rating is at its lowest point since the start of the Clone Wars between the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Davenbay goes on to play an address to the Galactic Senate by Vice Chairman Mas Amedda regarding this latest news. Amid boos from senators, Amedda claims that Palpatine's approval ratings are dwindling because the Senate is interfering with the Supreme Chancellor's business; according to Amedda, the Senate is tying up Palpatine's plans with bureaucratic nonsense. Davenbay concludes the report by disclosing Chokee & Chokee's latest collected approval ratings of the Senate, which have dropped to a low 31%.

HoloNet News — Chancellor Palpatine's Approval Rating Falls is the third podcast installment in the online HoloNet News podcast series written to accompany the development of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series. Released on December 12, 2008, on StarWars.com, Chancellor Palpatine's Approval Rating Falls has a run time of approximately seventy-three seconds and features the voice talents of David W. Collins as Rule Davenbay and Stephen J. Sansweet as Mas Ammeda. The podcast was written by Pablo Hidalgo, was co-produced by Hidalgo and Brooks Brown, had sound designed by Collins, and had music composed by Jesse Harlin.

A male Human and Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars, Palpatine is extremely popular in the Republic, being seen as an intelligent, kind, and benevolent leader. However, Palpatine is secretly a Dark Lord of the Sith named Darth Sidious, who created the Confederacy of Independent Systems and is directing both factions from behind the scenes. His ultimate goal is to rule the galaxy with an iron fist by taking power away from the Galactic Senate and giving it to himself as Supreme Chancellor. Around 21 BBY, Palpatine's approval rating among Inner Core citizens has fallen to 81%, but is still higher than the Galactic Senate's approval rating, which is only 31%.

Rule Davenbay is the male host of a news program on Dateline Coruscant, a HoloNet News agency. Sometime around 21 BBY, Danebay reports on his show that a recent poll by the independent polling agency Chokee & Chokee shows that Supreme Chancellor Palpatine's approval rating has fallen to 81%. In his report, Davenbay plays a response by Vice Chairman Mas Amedda to the Galactic Senate about the recent poll, with Amedda blaming the Senate for Palpatine's loss in popularity. Davenbay also notes that the Senate's approval rating is holding steady at 31%.

A male Chagrian, Mas Amedda is the Vice Chairman of the Senate during the Clone Wars, tasked with moderating debates in the Senate. A close advisor and confidant of Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, Amedda quickly addresses the Senate when Palpatine's approval rating falls to 81%. Amid a chorus of boos from the gathered senators, Amedda blames the Senate for Palpatine's drop in popularity, claiming that the Senate is undermining the Supreme Chancellor's war efforts. Amedda's speech to the Senate is later played during a HoloNet News report by Rule Davenbay.
